author: ajsutton
content: That one isnâ€™t actually fatal (log level reduced and Iâ€™m hunting it down to get rid of it). There was a period of ninfinalisation over the weekend though so I suspect youâ€™ll find an out of memory error in there which really was fatal.

author: benjaminion
content: <@557201004060213248> - is 357 one of yours? Apparently it hasn't made any attestations since 30 May. The whole block 312 - 439 is the same.

author: donschoe
content: yes, those are all mine.

author: donschoe

author: donschoe
content: I'm just about to pull latest master and try again

author: donschoe
content: wow my validator has 208 peers on witti

author: protolambda
content: Witti is having small problems. It looks like there is no split, but the latency is high, and there are many small forks and reorgs

author: protolambda
content: On the left: state table (incl skip slots) see how block-root stays the same sometimes (= skip slot) and even reverts back to an older one a few times (= parallel fork)

author: protolambda
content: I've been indexing the Witti chain for analysis/charts, will share those later this week.

author: protolambda
content: The eth1 client warning is because Goerli had some issues. Not sure why that would make prysm stop syncing eth2 though

author: p_bitfly
content: looks like the prysm goerli node is out of sync or the goerli issues do affect the eth2 chain

author: jonny.derp
content:
> <@!449019668296892420> https://gist.github.com/protolambda/ebdd737ad491e3ff43c374f4795126cb
<@!203220829473996800> i'm seeing peers with a head slot in the 60,000 range.  They don't have the "Sync_Status":"Behind" or "Synced" property...instead it is "Advanced".  Does this mean they have a different fork-digest?

author: protolambda
content: You need to ask <@!498009160982724610> about the exact meaning of those peerstore fields

author: protolambda
content: It's probably just older sync info that stuck around after a sync, while the node moved on

author: jonny.derp
content:
> It's probably just older sync info that stuck around after a sync, while the node moved on
<@!203220829473996800> im too dumb to understand those words

author: jonny.derp
content:
However in the lh code i see this:

```
    /// The peer has greater knowledge about the canonical chain than we do.
    Advanced { info: SyncInfo },
```

author: jonny.derp
content:
> It's probably just older sync info that stuck around after a sync, while the node moved on
<@!203220829473996800> 

so if what u are saying is true, then these peer counts could be inflated by nodes that are no longer online and only lazily removed

author: protolambda
content: No what I'm saying is that at some point the peer may have synced from my lighthouse node, or my node synced from them, and it never removed that knowledge from the peerstore after the sync.

author: protolambda
content: Best guess though, I'm not familiar with this peerstore approach of Age
